main event: An unidentified glowing white object was observed traveling toward the observer in Burney, California on April 19, 1967.
interesting points: The object was visible for about 10 minutes before it slowly disappeared in the west., Height finder radar confirmed the object's presence before it was lost., Weather conditions at the time were not likely to have supported extraordinary electromagnetic refractions., Discussions indicated that the object might have been a small aircraft with its landing lights on., The observation raised questions about the radar visibility of small airborne objects.
witness description: The observer was reportedly near the Red Bluff area and noted the object's altitude and movement.
